DOC.brief_summary: Primary objective of this trial will be to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intravitreal injections of Macugen (pegaptanib sodium) when given at least 7-14 days prior to vitrectomy in subjects with tractional retinal detachment (with or withoutmacular involvement) secondary to proliferative diabetic retinopathy. Secondary objective is to evaluate regression of neovascularization and progression of macular traction utilizing OCT and fundus photographs.
DOC.brief_title: A Single-Center Trial of Intravitreous Injections of Macugen (Pegaptanib Sodium) Given at Least 7 Days Before Vitrectomy Secondary To Tractional Retinal Detachment in Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy
DOC.criteria: Subjects of either gender aged 75 years or below diagnosed with tractional retinal detachment secondary to proliferative diabetic retinopathy. Subjects with vitreous hemorrhage obscuring the posterior pole will be excluded.
